parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Idler arm failure can cause steering to fail, leading to loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Idler arm tore off the frame

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the power steering pump bracket can cause the serpentine belt to jump off, resulting in loss of steering ability and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Bolts that hold the power steering pump bracket broke

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Steering column failure can cause loose steering, making it difficult to control the vehicle and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: had to replace the steering column.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the power steering system can cause loss of steering ability, making it difficult to control the vehicle and increasing the risk of accidents.
A fissure in the radiator can cause coolant leakage, leading to engine overheating, damage, and potential failure, which can result in a loss of vehicle control and increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: steam or smoke coming from the radiator.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden stalling of the engine can cause a loss of vehicle control, increasing the risk of accidents, especially when driving at high speeds.
Electrical system failures can cause fires, damage to components, and loss of vehicle control, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: smoke or fire coming from the dashboard or engine compartment

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Vehicle fires can cause serious damage, injury, or even death, and can occur without warning.
symptoms: smoke or flames coming from the engine compartment

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the serpentine belt can cause loss of power steering, overheating, and engine damage, increasing the risk of accidents.
Leaks in the exhaust system can cause carbon monoxide poisoning, which can be deadly.
symptoms: strong odors or smells coming from the exhaust system.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of engine components can cause engine damage, stalling, and loss of vehicle control, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: unusual noises or vibrations coming from the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the torque converter can cause the transmission to shift harshly, jerk, or stall, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: the vehicle jerks when shifting from 1st to 2nd gear
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the valve body can cause the transmission to shift erratically, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: the vehicle jerks when shifting from 1st to 2nd gear
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the differential spider gear can cause damage to the ring and pinion, bearings, and other components, leading to costly repairs and potentially causing loss of vehicle control.
symptoms: causing damage to the ring and pinion

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A transmission oil leak can cause a fire, leading to a significant risk of injury or death.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Seat Belt Latch and Retractor Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Malfunctioning seat belts can lead to occupant ejection, injuries, or fatalities in the event of an accident or sudden stop.
Malfunctioning child restraints can lead to injuries or fatalities in the event of an accident or sudden stop.
symptoms: difficulty securing or unsecuring child restraints.
